metadata.Title: CVE-2020-1934 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4.0 to 2.4.41, mod_proxy_ftp may use uninitializedmemory when proxying to a malicious FTP server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1934` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17').
